overwatch.db

Class ConnectionPool

  • java.lang.Object
    • overwatch.db.ConnectionPool

  • public class ConnectionPool
extends java.lang.Object
    Multithreaded database connection pooler. Creating new DB connections can be very slow. This spawns many of them in the background without holding up the rest of the program.
    Version:
    5
    Author:
    Lee Coakley

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ConnectionPool(int initialConns)
      Create a new connection pool and immediately begin making connections.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.sql.Connection getConnection()
      Get a connection from the pool.
      int getConnectionCount()
      Get the total number of active connections.
      boolean isConnectionAvailable()
      Check whether the pool has a connection ready to use.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args) 
      void returnConnection(java.sql.Connection conn)
      Returns a connection back into the pool so it can be reused elsewhere.
      void shutdown()
      Shuts down the connection pool.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConnectionPool

        public ConnectionPool(int initialConns)
        Create a new connection pool and immediately begin making connections. Keeps making connections until the amount given is reached. The pool automatically expands if there aren't enough and shrinks if there are too many unused ones.
        Parameters:
        initialConns - How many connections to make on startup.

    • Method Detail

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Shuts down the connection pool. This stops the background thread and closes all connections. The function blocks until this has been accomplished. After shutdown the pool can no longer be used.

      • isConnectionAvailable

        public boolean isConnectionAvailable()
        Check whether the pool has a connection ready to use. This is purely informational. You don't need to check before calling getConnection().
        Returns:
        Whether a connection is ready.

      • getConnectionCount

        public int getConnectionCount()
        Get the total number of active connections.
        Returns:
        total

      • getConnection

        public java.sql.Connection getConnection()
        Get a connection from the pool. If none are available it creates a new one. Make sure you put it back when finished using returnConnection(). Blocks until a connection is available.
        Returns:
        Connection

      • returnConnection

        public void returnConnection(java.sql.Connection conn)
        Returns a connection back into the pool so it can be reused elsewhere.
        Parameters:
        conn - Connection

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
